verses.verse: And the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> came to Jehu<WH3058> the son<WH1121> of Hanani<WH2607> against Baasha<WH1201>, saying<WH559>,

Forasmuch as I exalted<WH7311> thee out of the dust<WH6083>, and made<WH5414> thee prince<WH5057> over my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, and thou hast walked<WH3212> in the way<WH1870> of Jeroboam<WH3379>, and hast made my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> to sin<WH2398>, to provoke me to anger<WH3707> with their sins<WH2403>;

behold <WH1197>, I will utterly sweep away Baasha<WH1201> and his<WH310> house<WH1004>; and I will make<WH5414> thy house<WH1004> like the house<WH1004> of Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat<WH5028>.

Him that dieth<WH4191> of Baasha<WH1201> in the city<WH5892> shall the dogs<WH3611> eat<WH398>; and him that dieth<WH4191> of his in the field<WH7704> shall the birds<WH5775> of the heavens<WH8064> eat<WH398>.

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Baasha<WH1201>, and what he did<WH6213>, and his might<WH1369>, are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>?
And Baasha<WH1201> slept<WH7901> with his fathers<WH1>, and was buried<WH6912> in Tirzah<WH8656>; and Elah<WH425> his son<WH1121> reigned in his stead<WH4427>.

And moreover by<WH3027> the prophet<WH5030> Jehu<WH3058> the son<WH1121> of Hanani<WH2607> came the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> against Baasha<WH1201>, and against his house<WH1004>, both because of all the evil<WH7451> that he did<WH6213> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>, to provoke him to anger<WH3707> with the work<WH4639> of his hands<WH3027>, in being like the house<WH1004> of Jeroboam<WH3379>, and because he smote him<WH5221>.

In the twenty<WH6242> and sixth<WH8337> year<WH8141> of Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> began Elah<WH425> the son<WH1121> of Baasha<WH1201> to reign<WH4427> over Israel<WH3478> in Tirzah<WH8656>, and reigned two years<WH8141>.

And his servant<WH5650> Zimri<WH2174>, captain<WH8269> of half<WH4276> his chariots<WH7393>, conspired<WH7194> against him<WH8656>. Now he was in Tirzah, drinking<WH8354> himself drunk<WH7910> in the house<WH1004> of Arza<WH777>, who was over the household<WH1004> in Tirzah<WH8656>:

and Zimri<WH2174> went in<WH935> and smote<WH5221> him<WH4191>, and killed him<WH6242>, in the twenty and seventh<WH7651> year<WH8141> of Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, and reigned in his stead<WH4427>.

And it came to pass<WH4427>, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat<WH3427> on his throne<WH3678>, that he smote<WH5221> all the house<WH1004> of Baasha<WH1201>: he left<WH7604> him not a single man-child<WH8366>, <WH7023> neither of his kinsfolks<WH1350>, nor of his friends<WH7453>.

Thus did Zimri<WH2174> destroy<WH8045> all the house<WH1004> of Baasha<WH1201>, according to the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he spake<WH1696> against Baasha<WH1201> by<WH3027> Jehu<WH3058> the prophet<WH5030>,

for all the sins<WH2403> of Baasha<WH1201>, and the sins<WH2403> of Elah<WH425> his son<WH1121>, which they sinned<WH2398>, and wherewith they made Israel<WH3478> to sin<WH2398>, to provoke Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, to anger<WH3707> with their vanities<WH1892>.

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Elah<WH425>, and all that he did<WH6213>, are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>?

In the twenty<WH6242> and seventh<WH7651> year<WH8141> of Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> did Zimri<WH2174> reign<WH4427> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> in Tirzah<WH8656>. Now the people<WH5971> were encamped<WH2583> against Gibbethon<WH1405>, which belonged to the Philistines<WH6430>.

And the people<WH5971> that were encamped<WH2583> heard<WH8085> say<WH559>, Zimri<WH2174> hath conspired<WH7194>, and hath also smitten<WH5221> the king<WH4428>: wherefore all Israel<WH3478> made Omri<WH6018>, the captain<WH8269> of the host<WH6635>, king<WH4427> over Israel<WH3478> that day<WH3117> in the camp<WH4264>.
And Omri<WH6018> went up<WH5927> from Gibbethon<WH1405>, and all Israel<WH3478> with him<WH6696>, and they besieged Tirzah<WH8656>.

And it came to pass<WH2174>, when Zimri saw<WH7200> that the city<WH5892> was taken<WH3920>, that he went<WH935> into the castle<WH759> of the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, and burnt<WH8313> the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004> over him with fire<WH784>, and died<WH4191>,

for his sins<WH2403> which he sinned<WH2398> in doing<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>, in walking<WH3212> in the way<WH1870> of Jeroboam<WH3379>, and in his sin<WH2403> which he did<WH6213>, to make Israel<WH3478> to sin<WH2398>.

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Zimri<WH2174>, and his treason<WH7195> that he wrought<WH7194>, are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>?

Then were the people<WH5971> of Israel<WH3478> divided<WH2505> into two parts<WH2677>: half<WH2677> of the people<WH5971> followed<WH1961> Tibni<WH8402> the son<WH1121> of Ginath<WH1527>, to make him king<WH4427>; and half<WH2677> followed<WH310> Omri<WH6018>.

But the people<WH5971> that followed<WH310> Omri<WH6018> prevailed<WH2388> against<WH854> the people<WH5971> that followed<WH310> Tibni<WH8402> the son<WH1121> of Ginath<WH1527>: so Tibni<WH8402> died<WH4191>, and Omri<WH6018> reigned<WH4427>.

In the thirty<WH7970> and first<WH259> year<WH8141> of Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> began Omri<WH6018> to reign<WH4427> over Israel<WH3478>, and reigned twelve<WH8147> years<WH8141>: six<WH8337> years<WH8141> reigned<WH4427> he in Tirzah<WH8656>.

And he bought<WH7069> the hill<WH2022> Samaria<WH8111> of Shemer<WH8106> for two talents<WH3603> of silver<WH3701>; and he built<WH1129> on the hill<WH2022>, and called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the city<WH5892> which he built<WH1129>, after the name<WH8034> of Shemer<WH8106>, the owner<WH113> of the hill<WH2022>, Samaria<WH8111>.
And Omri<WH6018> did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and dealt wickedly above<WH7489> all that were before him<WH6440>.

For he walked<WH3212> in all the way<WH1870> of Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat<WH5028>, and in his sins<WH2403> wherewith he made Israel<WH3478> to sin<WH2398>, to provoke Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, to anger<WH3707> with their vanities<WH1892>.

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Omri<WH6018> which he did<WH6213>, and his might<WH1369> that he showed<WH6213>, are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> of the kings<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>?
So Omri<WH6018> slept<WH7901> with his fathers<WH1>, and was buried<WH6912> in Samaria<WH8111>; and Ahab<WH256> his son<WH1121> reigned in his stead<WH4427>.

And in the thirty<WH7970> and eighth<WH8083> year<WH8141> of Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> began Ahab<WH256> the son<WH1121> of Omri<WH6018> to reign<WH4427> over Israel<WH3478>: and Ahab<WH256> the son<WH1121> of Omri<WH6018> reigned<WH4427> over Israel<WH3478> in Samaria<WH8111> twenty<WH6242> and two<WH8147> years<WH8141>.
And Ahab<WH256> the son<WH1121> of Omri<WH6018> did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068> above all that were before him<WH6440>.

And it came to pass<WH7043>, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk<WH3212> in the sins<WH2403> of Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat<WH5028>, that he took<WH3947> to wife<WH802> Jezebel<WH348> the daughter<WH1323> of Ethbaal<WH856> king<WH4428> of the Sidonians<WH6722>, and went<WH3212> and served<WH5647> Baal<WH1168>, and worshipped him<WH7812>.
And he reared up<WH6965> an altar<WH4196> for Baal<WH1168> in the house<WH1004> of Baal<WH1168>, which he had built<WH1129> in Samaria<WH8111>.

And Ahab<WH256> made<WH6213> the Asherah<WH842>; and Ahab<WH256> did<WH6213> yet more<WH3254> to provoke Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, to anger<WH3707> than all the kings<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> that were before him<WH6440>.

In his days<WH3117> did Hiel<WH2419> the Beth-elite<WH1017> build<WH1129> Jericho<WH3405>: he laid the foundation<WH3245> thereof with the loss of Abiram<WH48> his first-born<WH1060>, and set up<WH5324> the gates<WH1817> thereof with the loss of his youngest<WH6810> son Segub<WH7687>, according to the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he spake<WH1696> by<WH3027> Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>.
